pr_title: EQL: Remove unused classes from reponse API

timeline.message:
EQL: Remove unused classes from reponse API

Remove Count class and related artifacts since that functionality is not
(yet) available.
Update parser name for better error reporting.

Fix #62131

timeline.bodyText: The name here looks like a mistake (left-over from count I presume) so I've changed it to hits instead to preserve the current naming conventions.
timeline.author: costin

timeline.bodyText: This file is just added in with small clean-up (removal of unused variables).
timeline.author: costin

timeline.bodyText: This will break requests in mixed clusters, are we ok with that?
timeline.author: imotov

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for flagging this.
EQL is currently experimental so the BWC compatibility is loose however I'd like where possible, to avoid this situation. I've added this topic to the agenda since I can see other areas where this might affect us (like using fields API) and we could use more testing.
replies.author: costin

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I am not sure that experimental necessarily means we don't support rolling restarts. My interpretation was that we can break it if there is a compelling reason for it. So, I would lean towards supporting it whenever possible. Two things we need to keep in mind: 1) if we will ever promote it to non-experimental in some 7.x release this might break rolling upgrade in 7.x. and 2) if we will promote it sometime in 8.x, we should be careful about breaking BWC with 7.last.
replies.author: imotov

replies.bodyText:
I've added a compatibility branch just to be safe. We never created Counter there's no actual instance to be read, just the bool which should be false always.
Nevertheless I've added the previous code since it was small.
replies.author: costin
